doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/2/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/2/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Kitty Cotter, and Jim Levin 2. Short news stories3. Gay Catholic group petitions New York City for the right to demonstrate outside of St. Patrick's Cathedral4. Discussion of publicly-closeted gay politicians courting the gay vote5. Accurate government reporting of AIDS, and the privacy issues involved in listing AIDS on death certificatesCOMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey6. Andy Humm on Reagan's Education secretary, William Bennett, opposing AIDS Education programs in schools7. News Watch, Colorado lawmakers ready to approve the testing, tracing, and quarantining individuals suspected of being infected with HIV8. San Francisco, Chronicle discloses its policy prohibiting the listing of surviving lovers in death notices9. ACLU considering suing nursing homes in Illinois that refuse to accept persons with AIDS10. Dutch National Broadcasting Service has begun a television service for lesbians and gay men11. Paper finds that certain DNA viruses have the ability to activate latent AIDS viruses12. Senator Edward Kennedy promises adequate AIDS budget beyond Reagan's lackluster budget13. Sports Report14. New segment Lavender Health, presented by the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health Concerns of the New York City Department of Health, discussion of AIDS-phobiaCOMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine15. George Trahanis interviews Jeff Goodman, Secretary of the Board of the Greater Gotham Business Council16. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazineCOMMERCIAL: The Monster2. GCN Cincinnati TV episode, "Georgia Vice"COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway musical "Beehive"4. COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity ball5. Olivia Negron interviews Gerard Ilaria, a volunteer social worker at New York Hospital and Columbia University Gay Health Advocacy Project6. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff [Air Date: 2/2/1987]: February 1987
